verses.kjv: Say ye unto your brethren, Ammi; and to your sisters, Ruhamah.
verses.web: “Say to your brothers, ‘My people!’ and to your sisters, ‘My loved one!’
verses.ct: Say to your brothers, 'My people!' and to your sisters, 'My loved one!'

verses.kjv: Plead with your mother, plead: for she is not my wife, neither am I her husband: let her therefore put away her whoredoms out of her sight, and her adulteries from between her breasts;
verses.web: Contend with your mother! Contend, for she is not my wife, neither am I her husband; and let her put away her prostitution from her face, and her adulteries from between her breasts;
verses.ct: "Confront your mother — confront her! She is not my wife, and I am not her husband. Tell her to stop her prostitution and remove the signs of adultery from her body.

verses.kjv: Lest I strip her naked, and set her as in the day that she was born, and make her as a wilderness, and set her like a dry land, and slay her with thirst.
verses.web: Lest I strip her naked, and make her bare as in the day that she was born, and make her like a wilderness, and set her like a dry land, and kill her with thirst.
verses.ct: If she doesn't, I will strip her naked and expose her like the day she was born. I will turn her into a wasteland, make her like a parched desert, and let her die of thirst.

verses.kjv: And I will not have mercy upon her children; for they be the children of whoredoms.
verses.web: Indeed, on her children I will have no mercy; for they are children of unfaithfulness;
verses.ct: I won't show mercy to her children either, because they are the offspring of her unfaithfulness.

verses.kjv: For their mother hath played the harlot: she that conceived them hath done shamefully: for she said, I will go after my lovers, that give me my bread and my water, my wool and my flax, mine oil and my drink.
verses.web: For their mother has played the prostitute. She who conceived them has done shamefully; for she said, ‘I will go after my lovers, who give me my bread and my water, my wool and my flax, my oil and my drink.’
verses.ct: Their mother has been a prostitute. The woman who conceived them has acted shamefully. She said, 'I'll chase after my lovers — the ones who give me my food and water, my wool and linen, my olive oil and wine.'

verses.kjv: Therefore, behold, I will hedge up thy way with thorns, and make a wall, that she shall not find her paths.
verses.web: Therefore behold, I will hedge up your way with thorns, and I will build a wall against her, that she can’t find her way.
verses.ct: So watch — I will block her path with a wall of thorns. I will build a barrier so she can't find her way.

verses.kjv: And she shall follow after her lovers, but she shall not overtake them; and she shall seek them, but shall not find them: then shall she say, I will go and return to my first husband; for then was it better with me than now.
verses.web: She will follow after her lovers, but she won’t overtake them; and she will seek them, but won’t find them. Then she will say, ‘I will go and return to my first husband; for then was it better with me than now.’
verses.ct: She will run after her lovers but never catch them. She will search for them but never find them. Then she'll say, 'I should go back to my first husband, because life was better with him than it is now.'

verses.kjv: For she did not know that I gave her corn, and wine, and oil, and multiplied her silver and gold, which they prepared for Baal.
verses.web: For she didn’t know that I gave her the grain, the new wine, and the oil, and multiplied to her silver and gold, which they used for Baal.
verses.ct: She never realized that I was the one who gave her the grain, the wine, and the olive oil. I was the one who lavished silver and gold on her — and she turned around and used it all to worship Baal.

verses.kjv: Therefore will I return, and take away my corn in the time thereof, and my wine in the season thereof, and will recover my wool and my flax given to cover her nakedness.
verses.web: Therefore I will take back my grain in its time, and my new wine in its season, and will pluck away my wool and my flax which should have covered her nakedness.
verses.ct: So I will take back my grain at harvest time and my wine when it ripens. I will reclaim the wool and linen I gave her to cover herself.

verses.kjv: And now will I discover her lewdness in the sight of her lovers, and none shall deliver her out of mine hand.
verses.web: Now I will uncover her lewdness in the sight of her lovers, and no one will deliver her out of my hand.
verses.ct: Now I will expose her shame right in front of her lovers, and no one will be able to rescue her from my hand.

verses.kjv: I will also cause all her mirth to cease, her feast days, her new moons, and her sabbaths, and all her solemn feasts.
verses.web: I will also cause all her celebrations to cease: her feasts, her new moons, her Sabbaths, and all her solemn assemblies.
verses.ct: I will put an end to all her celebrations — her festivals, her new moon observances, her Sabbaths, and every one of her sacred assemblies.

verses.kjv: And I will destroy her vines and her fig trees, whereof she hath said, These are my rewards that my lovers have given me: and I will make them a forest, and the beasts of the field shall eat them.
verses.web: I will lay waste her vines and her fig trees, about which she has said, ‘These are my wages that my lovers have given me; and I will make them a forest,’ and the animals of the field shall eat them.
verses.ct: I will destroy her grapevines and fig trees — the ones she bragged about, saying, 'These are the wages my lovers paid me.' I will turn them into wild thickets, and animals will devour them.

verses.kjv: And I will visit upon her the days of Baalim, wherein she burned incense to them, and she decked herself with her earrings and her jewels, and she went after her lovers, and forgat me, saith the LORD.
verses.web: I will visit on her the days of the Baals, to which she burned incense, when she decked herself with her earrings and her jewels, and went after her lovers, and forgot me,” says LORD.
verses.ct: I will punish her for all those days she burned incense to the Baals, when she dressed herself up with rings and jewelry, chased after her lovers, and forgot all about me," says the LORD.

verses.kjv: Therefore, behold, I will allure her, and bring her into the wilderness, and speak comfortably unto her.
verses.web: “Therefore behold, I will allure her, and bring her into the wilderness, and speak tenderly to her.
verses.ct: "But here is what I will do: I will win her back. I will lead her out into the wilderness and speak tenderly to her heart.

verses.kjv: And I will give her her vineyards from thence, and the valley of Achor for a door of hope: and she shall sing there, as in the days of her youth, and as in the day when she came up out of the land of Egypt.
verses.web: I will give her vineyards from there, and the valley of Achor for a door of hope; and she will respond there, as in the days of her youth, and as in the day when she came up out of the land of Egypt.
verses.ct: From there I will give her back her vineyards, and I will turn the Valley of Achor into a doorway of hope. She will sing there like she did when she was young, like the day she came up out of Egypt.

verses.kjv: And it shall be at that day, saith the LORD, that thou shalt call me Ishi; and shalt call me no more Baali.
verses.web: It will be in that day,” says LORD, “that you will call me ‘my husband,’ and no longer call me ‘my master.’
verses.ct: On that day," says the LORD, "you will call me 'my husband' and never again call me 'my master.'

verses.kjv: For I will take away the names of Baalim out of her mouth, and they shall no more be remembered by their name.
verses.web: For I will take away the names of the Baals out of her mouth, and they will no longer be mentioned by name.
verses.ct: I will remove the names of the Baals from her lips, and no one will even mention their names anymore.

verses.kjv: And in that day will I make a covenant for them with the beasts of the field, and with the fowls of heaven, and with the creeping things of the ground: and I will break the bow and the sword and the battle out of the earth, and will make them to lie down safely.
verses.web: In that day I will make a covenant for them with the animals of the field, and with the birds of the sky, and with the creeping things of the ground. I will break the bow, the sword, and the battle out of the land, and will make them lie down safely.
verses.ct: On that day I will make a covenant for them with the wild animals, the birds of the sky, and the creatures that crawl on the ground. I will shatter every bow, sword, and weapon of war and banish them from the land, so my people can lie down in safety.

verses.kjv: And I will betroth thee unto me for ever; yea, I will betroth thee unto me in righteousness, and in judgment, and in lovingkindness, and in mercies.
verses.web: I will betroth you to me forever. Yes, I will betroth you to me in righteousness, in justice, in loving kindness, and in compassion.
verses.ct: I will make you mine forever. I will bind you to me with righteousness and justice, with loving kindness and mercy.

verses.kjv: I will even betroth thee unto me in faithfulness: and thou shalt know the LORD.
verses.web: I will even betroth you to me in faithfulness; and you shall know LORD.
verses.ct: I will make you mine through faithfulness, and you will truly know the LORD.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass in that day, I will hear, saith the LORD, I will hear the heavens, and they shall hear the earth;
verses.web: It will happen in that day, I will respond,” says LORD, “I will respond to the heavens, and they will respond to the earth;
verses.ct: On that day, I will answer," says the LORD. "I will answer the heavens, and they will answer the earth.

verses.kjv: And the earth shall hear the corn, and the wine, and the oil; and they shall hear Jezreel.
verses.web: and the earth will respond to the grain, and the new wine, and the oil; and they will respond to Jezreel.
verses.ct: The earth will answer with grain, new wine, and olive oil, and they will all answer Jezreel.

verses.kjv: And I will sow her unto me in the earth; and I will have mercy upon her that had not obtained mercy; and I will say to them which were not my people, Thou art my people; and they shall say, Thou art my God.
verses.web: I will sow her to me in the earth; and I will have mercy on her who had not obtained mercy; and I will tell those who were not my people, ‘You are my people;’ and they will say, ‘My God!’ ”
verses.ct: I will plant her for myself in the land. I will show mercy to the one who was called 'No Mercy,' and I will say to those who were called 'Not My People,' 'You are my people!' And they will answer, 'You are my God!'"
